name: JavaScript South Bay & OC  | A Chapter of JavaScriptLA
description: This is our sister chapter of JavaScriptLA, a meetup group in Los Angeles that focuses on FullStack JavaScript Development including frameworks like Angular, React, Ember and Node.JS -- for the South Bay & OC Areas.  A group for anyone interested in JavaScript programming. All levels welcome from absolute beginners to advanced users.   Join us on Slack!

organizer.bio: I'm a web developer from Long Beach, now living in Los Angeles. I like tech & coding for work and going to parties for fun.  See you at the next meetup!

next_event.name: Practical ES6 - The Future of Javascript feat Ben Junya

name: LA Elixir Programming Language Meetup
description:
"Fifteen years ago. That was the last time I was this excited by a programming language, and that language was Ruby.
It wasn’t for lack of trying. I explored them all as they came out, but none grabbed me—none made me feel like I’d enjoy spending years digging in.
Then I found Elixir. Twice. The first time was a year ago, and I thought it was very nice, but not compelling. But Corey Haines pushed me to look again. He was right. Elixir is special.”
— Dave Thomas, author of “Programming Elixir"

We are a new meet-up group based in downtown Los Angeles. Our goal is to learn functional programming, and our language of choice is Elixir. We invite people to join our group and learn this exciting new paradigm and language.
Elixir is one of the newer players in the functional programming world. Elixir is influenced by languages such as Erlang and Clojure. It has taken many of the best features of those languages, and wrapped it up in a more friendly Ruby-like syntax. Elixir runs on the Erlang VM, which is a battle-tested platform built for high availability, fault tolerance and concurrency.

The community around the language is excellent. You will often see the creator of elixir, José Valim, answering questions on the web and in #elixir-lang on free node IRC.

name: Silicon Valley Satellite Data Comm
description:
To promote the interests, understanding and discussion of freeing machine to machine communications from the limitations of the Cellular and PSTN Networks.

Using outer space to connect that last node to the Net.

name: Let'sMakeStuff: Engineers+Designers+Artists+Makers+Creatives
description:
Hi,

This meetup group is meant for people who love making things and learning.

We learn by trial and error and from each other. 


The only requirement is to be open to learning and failing.  Play and have fun :). 


We may cover anything from 3D modeling + painting to hardware / arduino prototyping + machine learning / AI.


My name is Jason and I love pushing myself to learn things across multiple disciplines. The goal is to just keep learning and creating.  Some of my random projects:  instagram.com/jasonify42


All levels of experience welcome.



This is similar to what Super Happy Dev House used to be, but at a smaller scale and hopefully more inclusive for designers  and artists :).



#design #arduino #programming  #javascript #3d #zbrush #c4d #AE #AI #PS #houdini #haskell #blender #erlang  #webgl #jquery #meteor #node #maya #3dsmax #unity #uneral #painting #sketching #drawing #typography #logodesign

organizer.name: Jason
organizer.bio:
jasonify.com :::
 I love designing and building products.

name: San Francisco Bay Area Red Hat User Group
description:
This group is focused on bringing together the San Francisco Bay Area Red Hat User Community for business and technical presentations, conversations and perhaps some food and drink. Membership is open to Red Hat customers, partners and people interested in Red Hat technologies.

Some of the Red Hat products are: Red Hat Enterprise Linux, OpenStack, Storage (Ceph, GlusterFS), Virtualization (ovirt, kvm), CloudForms, FeedHenry (Node.js, Apache Cordova), JBoss Fuse (Apache Camel, Fabric8),  JBoss BPM (jBPM), JBoss Data Virtualization (Teiid), JBoss EAP (Wildfly), JBoss JWS (Apache Tomcat), JBoss Data Grid (Infinispan), JBoss A-MQ (Apache ActiveMQ), JBoss BRMS (Drools), OpenShift (Jenkins, Git, Kubernetes, Docker, OpenVSwitch, RHEL, RHEL Atomic).

name: Seattle Technical Managers (Program/Development/Product)
description:
A group for Technical Program, Development, and Product Managers in the greater Seattle area to meet periodically and discuss a range of current topics with peers in other roles, companies, and industries.

Topics will not necessarily be technical but the group aims to serve a diverse, "tech-savvy" membership better able to "get what you do" and participate in semi-technical discussions and presentations.

==================================
Nov. 14, 2015:

I had intended to organize the first meetings this fall. However my time has been monopolized by a busy new job, certification courses, and destruction of my cars by a drunk driver. So I should pass on organization of this group to someone else, or at least enlist some co-organizers, and will send out an email about that.

Absolutely welcome suggestions on what would make the group really valuable to you. Here are a few possibilities for the first meetings - any feedback / other suggestions?

Actual Agile experiences: 4-5 companies will spend 10-15 minutes each reviewing their (successful) experience implementing Agile methodology, and lessons learned. It sometimes seems that many companies say they use Agile methodology, but haven't really dove in and committed to it wholeheartedly. Let's hear some success stories.

Salary check: An evening event connecting 100 participants and 10 recruiters/HR managers. Meet one-on-one and to review resume and talk about yourself with the recruiter/manager and get their feedback on how your current salary compares to current market.

What is all this? Chef, Docker, CloudTalk, Hadoop, OpenStack, Node, R, React, Scala, Spark, etc. etc. etc. SMEs will spend 5-10 minutes on each and explain where/how used, pros and cons, show an example

name: Free Code Camp - CG

name: Dublin's Coders
description:
Our aim is to connect & help our network so that they can really make their mark in Dublin’s IT space. 


We're constantly broadening Dublin's software development network through our  successful meet-up's. This group involves a number of developers from Ireland's tech industry who speak all things Java every couple of months! 


* Join our Linkedin Group Page for news and discussions *

* Event locations always in the Dublin City Centre area *


***Speakers***
We're always looking for passionate developers to share their insights with our talented group. If you want to speak at our next event, or if you know someone that could fit the bill - drop Wendy a line now on 083 447 4873! 

Some of our expert speakers include:

• Brian Matthews, @bmatthews68

A Java Architect with over 25 years experience in the IT industry, transforming development teams around the world. Brain is the Co-Organiser of the globally recognised community tech event Atlassian User Group in Dublin, and is a Mentor/Champion for CoderDojo. 

• David Gonzalez, @dagonzago

A Senior Software Engineer with 9 solid years experience growing global IT companies. David has just released a book "Developing Microservices with Node.js" which is now available for purchase on Amazon by clicking here.

name: NodeJS Recife Meetup
description: Grupo sobre desenvolvimento voltado ao Node.js e todo seu ecossistema. Sejam todos bem vindos e "Always bet on JS"!

organizer.bio: GDE (Google Developer Expert) AngularJS, GDG Salvador Organizer, palestro em conferências pelo Brasil e contribuo com vários projetos open source. Atuo ativamente em comunidades com foco em desenvolvimento web, Workflow, web performance, etc.

name: Chepstow Hackers
description: The long term plan is to create a group for people interested in any and all aspects of coding and hacking, based in the Chepstow area but covering the whole M48/A48 corridor. Exactly what and where? I don't know. Sign up, and let's find out if there is interest and what people might want to do, then we'll meet. Goals? Teaching, learning, coding, hacking, building, socialising? Tech? Apps, web, games, open-source, Unity, c#, node, javascript, raspberry pi, arduino, android, linux? Hopefully we'll be able to pull people in from as far afield as Mathern, Caldicot, St Arvans, Tintern, Woolaston, Alvington, Aylburton, and Lydney. And maybe Bristol.

name: Gitter Meetup
description:
Gitter is the home of community. 

We provide free public chat rooms for developer communities and open source projects, as well as private chat rooms for technical teams and businesses.

Gitter is home to over 40,000 developer communities, including The .NET Foundation, Google Material Design, Angular.js, Backbone, Node.js, Scala, The W3C and many more.

organizer.name: Gitter
organizer.bio: Gitter is where developers and professionals come to talk. We provide free public chat rooms for developer communities and open source projects, as well as private chat rooms for technical teams and businesses.

name: Hyperledger Paris
description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community, as the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, Artificial Intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Because with Hyperledger we can.

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What.

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How.

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive Analysis of Hyperledger Startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.

name: Amsterdam Kubernetes/Cloud-Native Meetup
description: Meet other developers and users of Kubernetes. Kubernetes is Google’s solution for scheduling and orchestrating containers at scale. It handles scheduling onto nodes in a compute cluster and actively manages workloads to ensure that their state matches the users declared intentions. Any skill level is welcome; we’re all new to Kubernetes and we want to create an open, welcoming environment for other Kubernauts. Learn more about Kubernetes at http://kubernetes.io

description:
Java, open source and beyond.... that is the focus for this Meetup!

The list with topics is endless, to give you an idea:

Spring, Spring Boot, Spring Data, DevOps, Maven, Java 8, Java EE 7, Polymer, React.js, Docker, Eclipse, Microservices, IntelliJ, Oracle, Play framework, AngularJS, Angular2, Node.js, Kubernetes, KumuluzEE, Wicket, GWT, Material Design, Mesos, Apache Spark, Apache Camel, Bootstrap, Blender, Git, Vagrant, Dart, RxJS, Yeoman, Sonar, Nexus, Jenkins, CLM, Fortify, TDD, Scrum, Agile, Gradle, Groovy, Kotlin, Python, Swift, Arquillian, JUnit, Hibernate, Java FX, Cloud, Mockito, JSON, IoT, TypeScript, ECMAScript 6, MongoDB, Rest, Selenium, Selenide, Fitnesse, AI (Artificial Intelligence), Big Data, SPA (Single Page Applications), NoSQL, Relational Databases, Business Intelligence, Architecture, Scala

Come join us!

name: MarkLogic User Group Switzerland
description: Diese Gruppe ist für alle, die an Enterprise Data Stores für den Einsatz im Digital Business interessiert sind – für Neugierige und Experten. Enterprise Data Stores kommen immer dann zum Einsatz, wenn relationale Datenbanken an ihre Grenzen stossen. Bei unseren Treffen geben wir Tipps und Tricks, stellen Anwendungsbeispiele von Kunden vor und stellen neue Entwicklungen vor. Wir freuen uns auf jeden Teilnehmer und den Austausch mit unseren Gruppenmitgliedern. The MarkLogic User Group (MLUG) is for users and/or fans of MarkLogic and those who are interested in learning more about MarkLogic, XML, XQuery and related technologies. MUGL meetups are free and open to anyone that wishes to attend. There is no formal membership for the group. Our meetings are held quarterly in different regions in Germany. Want to know more about MarkLogic? Read on >> MarkLogic® is a new generation database platform that enables organisations to get more value from more data than ever before. Global enterprises and governments rely on MarkLogic to power intelligent, high performance applications aimed at analysing data for better insights and also running crucial day-to-day business operations. With MarkLogic, organisations achieve faster time-to-value than was possible with legacy databases, while minimising risk and improving data quality. MarkLogic is the only Enterprise NoSQL database—a powerful, agile, trusted database that has the speed and scale of NoSQL coupled with the enterprise features required. · Develop stronger applications faster with a flexible data model using Full-Stack JavaScript, JSON and Node.JS · Find relevant information easier with lightning fast, built-in search · Gain more intelligence in the data layer using semantics and bitemporal · Maintain data resiliency and consistency with ACID transactions, scalability and elasticity, certified security, and high availability and disaster recovery

name: Magdeburg Full Stack JavaScript
description:
Let's build a community for JavaScript in and around Magdeburg.
Whether you're a beginner wanting to ask questions or a senior developer wanting to discuss web development, everybody is welcome.

We will have monthly talks around Angular, Node.js and related topics like microservices and Docker.

name: Sophia Antipolis - Early morning software discussions
description: Rejoignons-nous de bonne heure à Sophia dans un petit café sympa et profitons-en pour prendre le petit déj et discuter des stacks technologiques que l'on aime utiliser au quotidien. L'idée est que chacun puisse présenter ses technos favorites (AngularJS, Node.js, Go, Docker, AWS, GKE, MongoDB, Cassandra, Hadoop, Ansible, …), en découvrir de nouvelles, et peut-être réaliser ensemble des projets les utilisant.

organizer.name: Luc Juggery
organizer.bio: Startup enthusiast, software guy (Node, Mongo, Docker), Mandarin's learner, chocolate eater. Each day should be the opportunity to learn something new

name: MarkLogic User Group Nordics
description:
The MarkLogic User Group Nordics is a group for users and/or fans of MarkLogic and those who are interested in learning more about MarkLogic Enterprise NoSQL database technology. We'll host informal events for users to meet, discuss, and share best practices regionally. This is an easy way to meet peers and learn how to get more out of MarkLogic Server. This is your Meetup group, so please tell us what you would like to hear! 

Want to know more about MarkLogic? 

MarkLogic® is a new generation database platform that enables organisations to get more value from more data than ever before. Global enterprises and governments rely on MarkLogic to power intelligent, high performance applications aimed at analysing data for better insights and also running crucial day-to-day business operations. 

With MarkLogic, organisations achieve faster time-to-value than was possible with legacy databases, while minimising risk and improving data quality. MarkLogic is the only Enterprise NoSQL database—a powerful, agile, trusted database that has the speed and scale of NoSQL coupled with the enterprise features required. 

• Develop stronger applications faster with a flexible data model using Full-Stack JavaScript, JSON and Node.JS

• Find relevant information easier with lightning fast, built-in search

• Gain more intelligence in the data layer using semantics and bitemporal

• Maintain data resiliency and consistency with ACID transactions, scalability and elasticity, certified security, and high availability and disaster recovery

name: From Big Ideas to Great Technology
description:
Transforming a great technology idea into reality can be daunting especially if you don't have a technical background. This group is here to help non-technical founders take the first steps in building their tech startup. We are not going to teach you how to program.

What we are going to do?

• Show you how to manage a tech startup.

• Describe what decisions you will face and show you the options.

• Introduce the available technology choices and help you decide what suits your needs best.

• Validate the technical aspects of your business model.

Some topics we will cover

• Finding the right team.

• Translating your ideas into tasks that developers can turn into code.

• Choosing the correct technologies.

• What types of software can be built, what exists?

• Building a web application? We will discuss what each part of the system does and what options are available and what PHP, Django, Ruby on Rails, Node.js mean to you.

• What does it involve to build a mobile application?

• Opensource what does that mean to me?

• Cloud or Dedicated servers?

• Amazon, AppEngine, Azure. What are the benefits and costs?

• Heroku and AWS Beanstalk, Azure websites, how does Platform as a Service help?

Databases

• SQL or NoSQL?

• What is NoSQL? Do I need it?

• Big Data do I need to know anything about it? Is it just hype?

• Machine Learning: What can it do?

• Natural Language Processing: What is involved? How complex can it be?

• Understanding the software development process.

• Managing your developers, knowing which task should be completed when.

• Outsourcing your development, understanding your responsibilities and what you need to do to keep control of the process.

About the Meetup

We aim to meet up regularly in Munich, at least once a month. For each meetup we'll focus on a topic introduced by one or two presenters followed by a discussion and networking (along with a few social drinks!). The goal of the meetup is to help educate non-technical founders and give them the knowledge and confidence to start and manage a tech startup.

The official language of the group is English.

organizer.name: Jana Kupfer
organizer.bio: Marketing Manager Web & Digital at Amazon Web Services - views are my own

name: Dev College - web & game development workshops
description:
Dev College to cykliczne spotkania, na których poruszamy tematy web i game developmentu, prowadzone w formie warsztatów. Każde ze szkoleń jest doskonałą okazją wymiany doświadczeń oraz poznania ludzi, na co dzień zajmujących się nowymi technologiami.

Dzielenie się wiedzą i doświaczeniem oraz wspólna nauka nowych technologii - to nasze cele.

Zapraszamy osoby, które miały już styczność z programowaniem i chcą rozszerzyć swoje umiejętności w technologiach: HTML5, JavaScript, Node.js, Web Sockets, AngularJS, Django, Python itp.
